title: How to Get YouTube on Roku: Complete Beginner's Guide

steps.title: Press the Home button on your remote.
steps.content: Press the Home button on your remote. This is next to a house icon.

steps.title: Select Streaming Channels on the Roku menu.
steps.content: Select Streaming Channels on the Roku menu. You'll find the Roku navigation menu on the left-hand side of the home screen. This will open the Channel Store.

steps.title: Select Search.
steps.content: Select Search . This is the magnifying glass.

steps.title: Enter youtube.
steps.content: Enter youtube . Results will load as you type.

steps.title: Select YouTube.
steps.content: Select YouTube . You'll see this on the right side. If you're looking for YouTube TV , select that tile instead.

steps.title: Select Add channel in the channel details.
steps.content: Select Add channel in the channel details. If you created a PIN number during the activation process, you may be asked to enter it now. YouTube will be added to your Roku. To open the app, select Go to channel on the details page, or find it on your home screen. You can now watch YouTube on your Roku.

steps.title: Go to https://channelstore.roku.com/browse in a web browser.
steps.content: Go to https://channelstore.roku.com/browse in a web browser. You can use a desktop or mobile browser. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Log into your Roku account.
steps.content: Log into your Roku account. Enter your email address and password. This is the account used to register your Roku device.

steps.title: Enter youtube in the search bar.
steps.content: Enter youtube in the search bar. You can also use the categories to find YouTube.

steps.title: Click Details.
steps.content: Click Details . This will open the app's page.

steps.title: Click Add channel.
steps.content: Click Add channel . The app will be added to your Roku device.

steps.title: Check your Roku device.
steps.content: Check your Roku device. If you don't see YouTube installed on your device, do the following: Navigate to Settings . Select System . Select System update . Select Check now .

steps.title: Open the Roku app.
steps.content: Open the Roku app. This app is available for iPhone, iPad, and Android. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap the search bar.
steps.content: Tap the search bar. This is at the top of the app. You can also tap Store to browse for YouTube manually.

steps.title: Enter youtube and search.
steps.content: Enter youtube and search. You should see the YouTube tile.

steps.title: Tap the YouTube app.
steps.content: Tap the YouTube app. This will open the app's details.

steps.title: Tap Add channel.
steps.content: Tap Add channel . You'll be asked to follow additional instructions on-screen to get the app on your Roku device.

steps.title: Check your Roku device.
steps.content: Check your Roku device . If you don't see YouTube installed on your device, do the following: Navigate to Settings . Select System . Select System update . Select Check now .
